page.title: 18BLAKENEY C. P. SCHOOL
page.content: The British School was opened in 1865 with 61 children in one large room. Around the turn of the century it had two classrooms and outside toilets added to its original partitioned room. In 1926 it was further extended : a temporary wooden building (five rooms) was provided for the 250+ scholars and it had now taken the name Blakeney Council School. Today, almost 60 years later, this script is being written in this 'temporary' building which now houses two large classrooms, library and office. The County Primary School has only 83 pupils (33 boys and 50 girls), 3.4 teaching staff, secretary (8 hrs), welfare assistant, part-time caretaker, cook and 3 lunch time supervisors. It also has a crossing warden to help the children cross the dangerous A48 trunk road.
